title: Rebekah Vardy's dad wades into Coleen Rooney sting row
text:
It’s kicking off (Picture: Getty/Rex)

Rebekah Vardy’s dad has insisted that his daughter’s Instagram account must have been hacked, hitting back at Coleen Rooney’s bombshell claims.

Carlos Miranda, a 66-year-old who lives in Bournemouth, said Rebekah had only ever had the nicest things to say about Coleen, and that he couldn’t believe ‘a pro’s wife would say something like that to another pro’s wife without any proof whatsoever’.

The mum-of-four was accused by Coleen of selling stories to newspapers.

Coleen made the accusations on Instagram, alleging that she set up a plot to expose her fellow WAG.

Rebekah has denied all the allegations and it has since been claimed that Vardy has called on lawyers to find out who had access to her Instagram and when.

‘Her account must have been hacked,’ said Carlos Miranda (Picture: BNPS)

‘Jamie and Wayne played together and it’s just awful that people can make accusations like that, especially when Rebekah is pregnant. Her account must have been hacked,’ said Carlos.

‘I felt I had to say something because my daughter is so upset by the whole thing. Rebekah has only ever had praise for Colleen – I’m just stunned. Why would my daughter want to make money from something like this?’

Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy (top) in 2016 (Picture: PA)

Speaking to the Mail Online, he added that Becky was ‘completely devastated’ and revealed that he found out about the scandals on the news.

‘I know people are sick of Brexit, but I came home at lunch and put on the TV and my daughter’s face was on nearly every channel,’ he added.

‘I had to switch the TV off in the end. I went to the Liverpool versus Leicester game last week and we had simply no idea this was about to kick off.’

Colleen Rooney accused Rebekah Vardy of selling stories to the press (Picture: Instagram)

Rebekah and Coleen became pals as their husbands played alongside each other for England.

However, on Wednesday morning Coleen sent shockwaves through the media when she alleged Rebekah had been selling fake stories about the Rooneys to newspapers.

Coleen wrote: ‘For a few years now someone I trusted to follow me on my personal Instagram account has been consistently informing The Sun newspaper of my private posts and stories.

Advertisement

‘There has been so much information given to them about me, my friends and my family – all without my permission or knowledge. After a long time of trying to figure out who it could be, for various reasons, I had a suspicion. To try and prove this, I came up with an idea. I blocked everyone from viewing my Instagram stories except ONE account. (Those on my private account must have been wondering why I haven’t had stories on there for a while.)’

Rebekah Vardy is reportedly in tears over the drama with Coleen Rooney (Picture: REX)

Coleen continued: ‘Over the past five months I have posted a series of false stories if they made their way into the Sun newspaper. And you know what, they did!

‘The story about gender selection in Mexico, the story about returning to TV and then the latest story about the basement flooding in my new house. ‘It’s been tough keeping it to myself and not making any comment at all, especially when the stories have been leaked, however I had to.

‘Now I know for certain which account/individual it’s come from.

‘I have saved and screenshotted all the original stories which clearly show just one person has viewed them. It’s…… Rebekah Vardy’s account.’
